org.rootsdev.polygenea.nodes

Class Note

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rootsdev.polygenea.Node
      • org.rootsdev.polygenea.nodes.Note
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Node>

    public abstract class Note
extends Node
    Note nodes are generic human-targeted information that can be attached to any other node. They are intended for small pieces of text. If more scope is needed, create a Citation to the creator of the note, a Source with the note's content, and connect it to claims like you would any other Source.
    Author:
    Luther Tychonievich. Released into the public domain. I would consider it a courtesy if you cite my contributions to any code derived from this code or project that uses this code.
    See Also:
    Property

      • Note

        public Note(java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map,
            NodeLookup lookup)
        Constructor used by JSON loading methods in Node and Database
        Parameters:
        map - A JSON object of this node
        lookup - How to resolve node references into Node objects
        Throws:
        JSONParser.MalformedJSONException - if the data is not proper JSON
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if JSON is not a Node or list of Nodes.

      • Note

        public Note(Node about,
            java.lang.String content,
            java.lang.String creator)
        Constructor used by code that wishes to create new objects
        Parameters:
        about - A Node to which to attached this note
        content - Whatever text we wish to provide
        creator - Who made the note (may be null for anonymous notes)

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.StringBuilder log)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Performs any validation that the node might need. The Node class just checks the UUID. Subclasses should override this method to perform any additional validation they might need, such as verifying that fields are not null.
        Overrides:
        validate in class Node
        Parameters:
        log - A place where descriptions of problems will be written. If the node is valid, log is not used.
        Returns:
        true if the node is valid, false otherwise.
